section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter governs those who are licensed and registered or who are applying for licensure or registration by the Board.

section.heading: Fees for Chiropractic Licensure and Registration.
section.text: The following fees are established by the Board:

para.text: Renewal fee to be paid on or before August 31 of the renewal year . . . $700;
Late renewal fee to be paid, in addition to the renewal fee, for renewal submitted within 30 days after August 31 . . . $500;
Reinstatement fee, in addition to the renewal fee and late fee in §§E and F of this regulation, for each renewal period that the license was expired after September 30 . . . $300;
Reactivation fee charged to move licensure status from inactive to active status . . . $200;
Penalty for failure to maintain correct address with the Board . . . $200;
Late renewal fee for chiropractic assistants . . . $200;
Continuing Education Course processing review fee per submission . . . $25;
Paper copy of laws and regulations . . . $25.
Fees are nonrefundable with the exception of the examination fee.
The examination fee may be refunded at the discretion of the Board if the applicant's written request is received by registered mail at least 14 days before the examination.

section.heading: Assessment for Health Care Professionals.
section.text: The applicant shall pay at the time of license renewal a fee for health care professionals, assessed by the Maryland Health Care Commission (MHCC), as specified in COMAR 10.25.02.

annotations.annotation: Health Occupations Article, §§3-205 and 3-206, Annotated Code of Maryland
